name: Gluten-Free Dehydrated Rosemary and Cranberry Crisps
author: sweetpea48507
summary: Trying to eat healthier and this is a new crisp-type cracker which maintains high nutritional values. It combines natural proteins fruits and vegetables. Kids won't notice the kale.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon garlic and dried vegetable seasoning
Himalayan salt and cracked black pepper to taste
directions: Place almonds in a bowl and pour in enough water to cover; let soak, 8 hours to overnight
Combine almonds, hemp seeds, chia seeds, rosemary, stevia powder, garlic and vegetable seasoning, salt, and black pepper together in a large bowl
Pulse coconut flour and dried cranberries together in a food processor until evenly combined; add to seed mixture
Pulse bananas, apple, figs, cabbage, and kale together in a food processor until pureed; add to seed mixture
Mix seed mixture together using your hands until dough is well mixed; let stand for 30 minutes
Divide dough in half and place each half onto a sheet of parchment paper
Top each roll with another sheet of parchment paper
Roll dough using a rolling pin until thin; cut into squares and transfer to a food dehydrator using a spatula
Dehydrate crackers, rotating racks as needed, according to manufacturer's instructions until crisp, 8 to 10 hours
